com.azwave.androidzwave.zwave.driver

Class CdcAcmSerialDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.azwave.androidzwave.zwave.driver.CdcAcmSerialDriver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UsbSerialDriver

    public class CdcAcmSerialDriver
extends java.lang.Object
    USB CDC/ACM serial driver implementation.
    Author:
    mike wakerly (opensource@hoho.com)
    See Also:
    Universal Serial Bus Class Definitions for Communication Devices, v1.1

        public void open()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: UsbSerialDriver
        Opens and initializes the device as a USB serial device. Upon success, caller must ensure that UsbSerialDriver.close() is eventually called.

      • setParameters

        public void setParameters(int baudRate,
                          int dataBits,
                          int stopBits,
                          int parity)
        Description copied from interface: UsbSerialDriver
        Sets various serial port parameters.
        Specified by:
        setParameters in interface UsbSerialDriver
        Parameters:
        baudRate - baud rate as an integer, for example 115200.
        dataBits - one of UsbSerialDriver.DATABITS_5, UsbSerialDriver.DATABITS_6, UsbSerialDriver.DATABITS_7, or UsbSerialDriver.DATABITS_8.
        stopBits - one of UsbSerialDriver.STOPBITS_1, UsbSerialDriver.STOPBITS_1_5, or UsbSerialDriver.STOPBITS_2.
        parity - one of UsbSerialDriver.PARITY_NONE, UsbSerialDriver.PARITY_ODD, UsbSerialDriver.PARITY_EVEN, UsbSerialDriver.PARITY_MARK, or UsbSerialDriver.PARITY_SPACE.

      • setReadBufferSize

        public final void setReadBufferSize(int bufferSize)
        Sets the size of the internal buffer used to exchange data with the USB stack for read operations. Most users should not need to change this.
        Parameters:
        bufferSize - the size in bytes

      • setWriteBufferSize

        Parameters:
        bufferSize - the size in bytes
